title: Andy Biggs
added: Biggs opposes wearing masks to prevent the transmission of [[COVID-19]], encouraging Arizonans to not wear masks.<ref name="Innes">{{cite news |last1=Innes |first1=Stephanie |title=Arizona Congressman Andy Biggs tweets against wearing masks, gives other questionable COVID-19 advice |url=https://www.azcentral.com/story/news/local/arizona-health/2020/09/08/rep-andy-biggs-tweets-covid-19-wearing-masks-hydroxychloroquine/5748715002/ |accessdate=20 November 2020 |work=The Arizona Republic |date=8 September 2020}}</ref> In July 2020, Biggs tweeted that people should not trust [[Anthony Fauci]] or [[Deborah Birx]]. He has called for the [[White House Coronavirus Task Force]] to be disbanded. During a major outbreak in the summer of 2020 in Arizona, Biggs questioned the hospitalization numbers and called governor [[Doug Ducey]]'s two-month lockdown a result of "hysteria" from "Democratic Leftists."<ref name="Krejci">{{cite news |last1=Krejci |first1=Cleo |title=Contradicting medical evidence and health experts, Biggs, Gosar cast doubt on severity of COVID-19 in Arizona |url=https://www.azcentral.com/story/news/politics/arizona/2020/07/02/andy-biggs-paul-gosar-cast-doubt-severity-covid-19-arizona/3258469001/ |accessdate=20 November 2020 |work=The Arizona Republic |date=2 July 2020}}</ref> In September 2020, Biggs posted a series of tweets supporting the use of [[hydroxychloroquine]] to prevent COVID-19 and demanding that Arizonans should "embrace" it. The drug cannot prevent COVID-19.<ref name="Innes"/>
